c74object.name: cage.extract
c74object.digest: Extract portion of roll or score
c74object.description: Outputs a portion of a bach.roll or bach.score.

objarg.name: start
objarg.description: The optional first argument sets the initial value for the starting point for the extraction (in milliseconds for bach.roll, as measure number for bach.score).

objarg.name: end
objarg.description: The optional second argument sets the initial value for the ending point for the extraction (in milliseconds for bach.roll, as measure number for bach.score).

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs result of the last extraction.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Extract portion of roll or score
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet is considered as the original roll or score gathered syntax. The portion defined via the number in the second and third inlet is extracted (see number method), and output in gathered syntax. The output header content is the same as the input header content.
An llll in the second and third inlet is automatically converted into number.

method.name: number
method.description: If the input is a roll, a number in the second inlet sets the starting point, in milliseconds, for the extraction. A number in the third inlet sets the ending point, in milliseconds for the extraction (or use a negative value to mean: till the end). If the input is a score, the two numbers are expected to be measure numbers (negative numbers allowed).

attribute.name: ceilmeasures
attribute.description: Force ending score to have the length given by the region extremes (if both extremes are positive). This means that if one asks for a cropping between measures 3 and 6 of a score having only 4 measures, the output score will add 2 empty measures for each voice. By default it is on.

attribute.name: endmarker
attribute.description: Add an ending marker for the cropped portion (only for bach.roll content). By default it is off.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: startmarker
attribute.description: Add a starting marker for the cropped portion (only for bach.roll content). By default it is off.

c74object.discussion: The object is a simple wrapper for the subroll or subscore messages.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The object is a simple wrapper for the subroll or subscore messages.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: extract, subroll, roll, subscore, score, crop, portion.
